frame.name: Artificiality
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> is evaluated for whether or not it belongs to a particular <fen>Reference_category</fen> in a context where its category membership is doubtful. The criterion or criteria that are relevant to evaluating <fen>Reference_category</fen> membership depend on the individual lexical units and/or on the context. Typically, either the material composition of the <fen>Entity</fen>, its method of creation, or the identity (and proper authority) of its creators are critical for proper category membership. Note that <fen>Entity</fen> also covers behaviors.
<ex>It can be hard to get your money back after discovering you've bought a <t>bogus</t> <fex name="Reference_category">autograph</fex> for hundreds or thousands of dollars! </ex>
<ex>It can be hard to get your money back after discovering you've bought <fex name="Entity">a BOGUS autograph</fex> for hundreds or thousands of dollars! </ex>
<ex>A <t>bogus</t> <fex name="Reference_category">policeman</fex> pulling over motorists was arrested after stopping a car carrying four real officers.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">A BOGUS policeman pulling over motorists</fex> was arrested after stopping a car carrying four real officers.</ex>
<ex>You people are pretty thick if you think you have evidence to prove that <fex name="ent">the moon landing</fex> <m>was</m> <t>fake</t>.</ex> <ex>You people are pretty thick if you think you have evidence to prove that the <fex name="Reference_category">moon landing</fex> <m>was</m> <t>fake</t>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> that is being evaluated in terms of whether it is an instance of the <fen>Reference_category</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ent">The bomb found at the US Embassy in Berlin</fex> <m>was</m> <t>fake</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reference_category
FE.definition: <def-root>The type relative to which the <fen>Entity</fen> is evaluated.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Entity</fen> seems to belong (or not, if so specified by the lexical unit) to the category of the <fen>Reference_category</fen> is clear. Typically, this frame element is realized as an end-of-scale expression.
<ex>Of course, the picture was <fex name="deg">completely</fex> <t>fake</t>, as could be seen by a number of clues.</ex></def-root>
